intro: Dalrympelea sphaerocarpa var. sphaerocarpa, commonly known as the yellow quandong, is a shrub native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its yellow, fleshy fruits that are edible when ripe. The plant typically grows in sandy or loamy soils and is adapted to dry, warm climates. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in dense inflorescences, adding to its ornamental value.
